intro: Saxifraga babiana, commonly known as the Cape bellflower, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is characterized by its rosette of fleshy, silver-green leaves and produces showy, bell-shaped flowers in shades of pink, red, and white. The plant thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often growing in rocky or sandy habitats. It is a perennial species that is well adapted to Mediterranean climates. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for rock gardens and containers.
